description:
> Grab any output or pattern to a value you can use. **Description:** A log filter processes the output of a command,script or plugin
Starter examples here include:- - Capture entire output with multi line regex - Capture single value with regex - Mask sensitive data (eg Passwords) - Parse Json Objects - Parse output and provide visual indicators **Assumptions:** - RBA with Runner Installed OR Self Hosted (PAOP) - Linux Tested **Documentation:** [Log Filters](https://docs.rundeck.com/docs/manual/log-filters/)
name: 4. Capturing Output via log filters

commands.description: Capture Everything in output with log filter
commands.script:
#Example command output, captured via multiline regex log filter
echo "kubectl get namespaces"
echo "/n"
echo "NAME              STATUS   AGE"
echo "default           Active   7d1h"
echo "kube-node-lease   Active   7d1h"
echo "kube-public       Active   7d1h"
echo "kube-system       Active   7d1h"
echo "travelduty        Active   7d1h"

commands.description: Capture specific data in output via log filter
commands.script:
#Example command output, captured via multiline regex log filter
echo "Linux ip-10-64-0-90.ec2.internal 4.14.291-218.527.amzn2.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Aug 26 09:54:31 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux"

#Example command output, captured via multiline regex log filter
echo "Your Password is Pr0CessAutoMation20222111 "

commands.description: Parse Output for Positive or Negative Indicators
commands.script:
#Example command output, captured via multiline regex log filter
echo 'ping: www.doesntwork.com: Name or service not known            403648        0    403648   0% /run/user/1000'
